intro: Hemiphora uncinata, commonly known as the hooked hemiphora, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It has hairy leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. Hemiphora uncinata is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
